instruction: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biriyani

This is a bit easier than the biriyani we make in Kannur. It's easier to prepare. This isn’t made with ghee rice. It’s made using water and rice. Basmati rice is used here. In Kannur biriyani, regular rice is used. That’s the difference. Let's see how to make Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biriyani at home.

For making biriyani, I’ve taken basmati rice here. This brand is called Davat. I mostly use it when I’m in Abu Dhabi. I’m in Abu Dhabi now, so I always buy this rice here. It’s a good rice. When you cook it, the grains won’t stick to each other. It's a long grain and very good. So, if you get it, try buying this brand.
I’ve taken 4 cups of basmati rice. Let’s wash it thoroughly. After that, soak it in water. If we soak it for at least 1 hour, the rice will cook better. Cover it and keep aside after soaking.

instruction: Add chicken pieces to the marinade along with green chilies, half of the mint and coriander leaves. Mix thoroughly and cover. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
title: Marinate Chicken

transcript_segments.text: I’ve taken 4 cups of basmati rice. Let’s wash it thoroughly. After that, soak it in water. If we soak it for at least 1 hour, the rice will cook better. Cover it and keep aside after soaking.

instruction: Thinly slice the onions. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat and fry the onions in batches until golden brown and crispy.
title: Slice and Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: I’ve taken 4 medium-sized onions here. Slice and fry them until golden brown. This is what we call "Bista" in our Thalassery biriyani. I’ve cut 4 onions like this. Now let’s fry them well. For that, I’m heating oil in a pan.

Once the oil is hot, fry the onions until golden brown. With this amount of oil, you can fry 4 onions in 4 batches. If you use more oil, you can fry all at once, but it wastes oil. So this way is better. Fry them well.
Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Let’s transfer the fried onions to a plate. Let them cool a bit so they become crisp. Don’t keep them piled up; spread them out slightly. Place all the fried onions onto a plate like this.

instruction: Remove fried onions and place on paper towels to absorb excess oil. Set aside half for layering later.
title: Drain Fried Onions

transcript_segments.text: Let’s transfer the fried onions to a plate. Let them cool a bit so they become crisp. Don’t keep them piled up; spread them out slightly. Place all the fried onions onto a plate like this.
Now crush the rest of the onions with your hands. All the onions are crushed and ready. Set them aside. I’ve washed 1.5 kg of chicken, cut into big pieces.

instruction: Mix the remaining half of the fried onions into the marinated chicken.
title: Add Onions to Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Now add more than half of the crushed onions to the chicken. Keep the remaining aside. Add 3 tablespoons of crushed ginger, garlic, and green chili – about 12–14 large garlic cloves, a small piece of ginger, and 10 green chilies.
1½ tbsp chili powder 1½ tsp turmeric powder 1 tsp garam masala powder ½ handful of mint leaves 1 handful of coriander leaves
1¼ cups of curd 1¼ cups of curd 1¼ cups of curd 1¼ cups of curd
Now mix all the ingredients thoroughly.
Close the lid and let it marinate for half an hour. If you have more time, marinate for 1 hour.

instruction: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
title: Rinse and Soak Rice

transcript_segments.text: Close the lid and let it marinate for half an hour. If you have more time, marinate for 1 hour.

instruction: Warm the milk slightly and add saffron strands. Let it sit for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.
title: Prepare Saffron Milk

transcript_segments.text: Let’s start making the masala. I’ve placed a pan on the stove. Once hot, add 3 tablespoons of cow ghee.
Add 3 tablespoons of sunflower oil.
After adding chicken and masala to the pan, cook for 3 minutes on high flame. Chicken tastes better when cooked on high flame.
I’ve cooked the chicken for 3 minutes on high. Now close the lid and cook on low to medium flame. Chicken will be ready in 10 minutes. So I’m closing the lid now.

instruction: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon, star anise, peppercorns).
title: Boil Water with Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Water is slightly hot now. Add 2 large cinnamon sticks, 4 cardamoms, 4–5 cloves, 2 tablespoons sunflower oil, and salt to taste.

instruction: Drain soaked rice and add it to the boiling spiced water. Cook until the rice is 70% done—grains should still be slightly firm. Drain the rice immediately.
title: Parboil the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Wait till the water boils before adding rice. Now that the water is boiling, add the soaked rice after draining all water.
Add the rice to the water and stir with a spoon.
After adding rice, water has started boiling again. (Repeated many times – likely an editing error.)
If rice is overcooked, the biriyani won’t taste good. So be careful. Now let’s check the masala. Chicken is well-cooked and masala is ready, but there's too much water in it. So we need to reduce it.
Cook on high flame without closing the lid so the water evaporates. Don’t dry it out fully; make it a thick gravy. Now check the rice – it’s done in 5 minutes.
Remove rice from stove and drain the water. I’ve used a clip for draining – use whatever way is easier for you. The masala has thickened and is ready.

After mixing, remove the masala from the stove. Rice is nicely cooked and fluffy. This is how it should look. Now let’s start layering the biriyani in a big vessel placed on the stove. The vessel should be hot.

instruction: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spread the marinated chicken evenly as the bottom layer.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: After mixing, remove the masala from the stove. Rice is nicely cooked and fluffy. This is how it should look. Now let’s start layering the biriyani in a big vessel placed on the stove. The vessel should be hot.
Add a little ghee to the vessel – about 1.5 tablespoons. Don’t add too much. (Incomplete sentence due to mixed language.)
Add half of the fried onions. Don’t add all. Then add half of the chicken masala. Include some of the gravy as well.

instruction: Spread the parboiled rice evenly over the chicken layer.
title: Layer the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Now add a layer of rice. We did 1 of 3 layers earlier. Add the remaining rice in the second layer.
Now add color. I’m using turmeric mixed in water. You can use saffron in milk or food color – yellow, orange, or red as you prefer. Now sprinkle mint and coriander leaves.
(Unintelligible – possibly unrelated or background speech)
Add chicken masala over the rice layer. Then add another layer of rice.

instruction: Top with the reserved fried onions, remaining mint and coriander leaves, saffron milk, and drizzle with ghee.
title: Add Final Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: Add chicken masala over the rice layer. Then add another layer of rice.
Now we can add yellow color on top again. (Repeated multiple times for emphasis.)

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or seal the edges with dough to trap steam inside.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: Close the lid and cook on low flame for 10 minutes. Otherwise, the bottom may burn. If you're using a non-stick pan, an old one is better.

instruction: Place the sealed pot on high heat for 5 minutes. Then reduce to very low heat and let cook (dum) for 25–30 minutes.
title: Cook on High and Low Heat

transcript_segments.text: Close the lid and cook on low flame for 10 minutes. Otherwise, the bottom may burn. If you're using a non-stick pan, an old one is better.
